name: Hourai Jousen
description:
Hourai Jousen is an award-winning sake and an exceptional futsushu. It displays an elegant, clean fruitiness reminiscent of higher-grade sake, supported by a rich, satisfying texture. Brewed from plump steamed rice polished to 70%, the palate is round with gentle acidity, a touch of sweetness and fine intensity. The aroma is fresh and clean, with notes of cedar and nutmeg, while the flavours bring citrus and floral apricot, finishing rounded and pure.
Watanabe Hourai is based in central Japan in the charming town of Hida-Furukawa, Gifu Prefecture.
manufacturer_info: Watanabe Hourai is based in central Japan in the charming town of Hida-Furukawa, Gifu Prefecture. The brewery produces award-winning sake with exceptional quality and traditional brewing methods.

name: Toko Chokarakuchi Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Toko Chokarakuchi from Kojima Sohonten from Yamgata is a super dry sake, also called Chokarakuchi. This traditional sake made with local rice has a mild aftertaste so that this is called a 'daily sake' in Japan.Nice companion of classic Japanese dishes such as Yakiimo, Shabu Shabu and Yakimono.This sake is best served cold in a white wine glass.Prefecture:YamagataAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:ChokarakuchiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:100% Local grownSMV:+8How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)show moreshow less

name: Adatara Ginjo - 300ml
description:
Adatara Ginjo from Okunomatsu was named as Japan best sake in 2018. The sake won the prize at the most prestigious sake blind tasting in the world, the International Wine Challenge, where no less than 1639 top sake were submitted.
Lots of fruit such as melon, pear and lychee in the aroma and on the pallet with subtle, beautiful acidity that accentuates the fine flavours nicely. A lovely clean aftertaste completes this one.This sake can be drunk on its own but also tastes great with cheese and lighter dishes.This sake is best enjoyed cold in a sake/wine glass.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.5%Classification:GinjoContent:300mlImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: Okunomatsu is located in Fukushima Prefecture. Okunomatsu produces high-quality sake using traditional brewing methods.

name: Mio Sparkling - 300ml
description: Mio Sparkling is a clear, sparkling sake with a peachy aroma. It is not for nothing that it is the best -selling sparkling sake in the world. The playful sparkling makes way for a taste of pear and grape. The fruity sweetness is combined with fresh acids. Both as an aperitif with a meal or with a dessert. A beautiful and tasteful sake.Enjoy this sake cold in a champagne flûte.Prefecture:HyogoAlcohol:5.5%Style:SparklingContent:300mlHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Hyogo Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Aladdin Nigori - 300ml
description: Aladdin Nigori sake of Aizu Homare has a history that goes back to the start of the Showa period. While it retains the traditional essence of this Nigori Sake, efforts are made to adapt it to modern wishes. The fruity aroma, reminiscent of bananas, harmonizes sweetness and acidity, which enhances the overall freshness of the drink. It is known as an invigorating sake with a taste that is both refreshing and not overly sweet.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:70%SMV:-23Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Fukushima Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Shiroki-Tenryu Nigori - 300ml
description: The Kikusui Shiroki-Lenryu is a silky-soft Nigori Sake with a rich rice caroma with creamy in the mouth. The mild sweetness and Umami come up well when serving hot, although most unfiltered sake's are recommended to drink cooled. Juicy, creamy and ripe with apple and banana fruit in the mouth. Sweet and spicy with honey rice, apple and peach fruit, creamy yogurt, mandarin and brown sugar as a aftertaste. This is highly recommended, it is not without reason that different international sake prices won, including the prestigious International Wine Challenge in 2021.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.3%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:65%How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Awards:IWC 2025 - Gold Award WinnerGiftbox:NoImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Nagano Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Homare Nigori - 300ml
description:
Homare Nigori is a
delicious creamy cloudy sake with a fine velvety structure on the tongue due to
the rice sediment. The Nigori Sake of Aizu Homare has a history dating back to
the beginning of the Showa period. While retaining the traditional essence of
this Nigori Sake, efforts have been made to adapt it to modern desires. The
fruity aroma, reminiscent of bananas, harmonizes the sweetness and acidity,
enhancing the overall freshness of the drink. It is known for being an
invigorating sake with a flavor that is both refreshing and not overly
sweet.Shake before use so
that the rice sediment passes through the entire bottle.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:70%SMV:-25Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Fukushima Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Aladdin Junmai - 300ml
description: Aladdin Junmai Aizu Homare's Aladdin is steeped in the fruity aroma from the "Utsukushima Yume" yeast developed by the Fukushima prefecture. The Homare Aladdin Junmai-Sake is served in a small elegant blue bottle, enjoy its refreshing taste.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:58%Acidity:1.5How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Fukushima Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Kubota Senju Ginjo - 300ml
description:
Kubota Senju Ginjo has a friendly nose with tones of apple, pear and lychees, low minerality, soft tender velvety taste with a clean "kire".
 
 Excellent choice as a supervisor for a wide range of Japanese dishes including grilled and fried dishes.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:15.0%Classification:GinjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:50%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:+5Acidity:1.1How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Niigata Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Mio Clear Sparkling- 300ml
description: Mio Clear is slightly drier than the regular Mio sparkling but does have that same friendly sweetness and delicious bubbles. In the nose melon, pear, anise, laurel and toasted cereals which comes back nicely on the palate. Taste sensation of fine bubbles with a fine taste palette and a delicious aftertaste are completing this sake.This sake is ideal for a sushi meal but also great as unique aperitif.This sake is best served cold in a Champagne flûte.Prefecture:HyogoAlcohol:5.0%Style:SparklingContent:300mlHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Hyogo Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Homare Yuzushu Junmai - 300ml
description:
Homare Yuzushu Junmai is a gastronomic masterpiece that invites your 
taste buds for an enchanting journey. Made by Aizu Homare, it combines 
the invigorating freshness of Yuzu with the age-old tradition of Sake 
making.This exceptional merger reveals a wonderful mix of citrus
 -like liveliness and the refined elegance of Sake, and orchestrates a 
medley of flavours that will take you to a realm of culinary spell. 
Whether you enjoy it in itself or use it to enrich your favourite 
dishes, Homare Yuzu is like an extraordinary addition to your 
gastronomic adventures.Immerse yourself in the spell of Yuzu and Sake as never before with this extraordinary creation of Aizu Homare.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:10.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Fruit infused, Yuzu & Citrus familiyContent:300mlSMV:-70Acidity:14.7How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: This sake is produced in Fukushima Prefecture using traditional Japanese brewing methods.

name: Jozen Sparkling - 360 ml
description: Jozen Sparkling Sake produced by the Shirataki Sake Brewery impresses with his fruity but at the same time not too sweet taste. Showing of Lychee and Guave as well as tones of green apple.Jozen Sparkling Sake is an ideal aperitif, but also fits well with lighter dishes or as a beautiful sake in combination with desserts.Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:13.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:SparklingContent:360mlRice polishing ratio:60%SMV:-40Acidity:3.5How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)show moreshow less

name: Nichi-Ichi Sparkling Brut - 300 ml
description: Ninki-Ichi Sparkling Brut is an elegant medium dry sparkling sake with a subtle mousse. Nice balance and a pleasant aftertaste.Delicious as a fresh aperitif but also good combinations with a sushi meal or raw oysters, or just nice and festive. This sake can best be served cold in a champagne flûte.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:11.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:SparklingContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:60%SMV:-18Acidity:2.4Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Kyokuko Junmai Ginjo - 300 ml
description: Typical of specially brewed such as the Kyokuko Junmai Ginjo Sake are the floral and fruit tones that come to the fore in the taste and the bouquet. This has to do with, among other things, much colder fermentation temperatures than normally brewed sake and yet the area where this sake comes from is extremely suitable for this.Prefecture:TochigiAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:48%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiSMV:+1Acidity:1.5How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Hourai ANA First Class Junmai Ginjo - 300 ml
description: ANA First Class Junmai Ginjois normally served exclusively on ANA Airlines flights, but we are fortunate to have secured a limited quantity. This sake from Watanabe Hourai in Gifu is smooth and easy to drink, with a fruit-forward nose and a juicy character. Notes of apple, pear, melon, and white grapes appear in both aroma and flavour, supported by a clean, rounded, and dry profile, finishing with a crisp dryness.Watanabe Sake Brewery, founded in 1850 in Hida Furukawa, is among Japan’s leading artisanal breweries. It is part of the historic “White Wall” district, where white-walled kura stand side by side along a narrow canal. Named Best Brewery in 2021 and honoured with multiple international awards, Watanabe has secured a reputation as one of Japan’s finest. With an increasing focus on international markets, its sake are now Vegan and Kosher certified.Prefecture:GifuAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:55%SMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Watanabe Sake Brewery, founded in 1850 in Hida Furukawa, is among Japan’s leading artisanal breweries. Named Best Brewery in 2021 and honoured with multiple international awards, Watanabe has secured a reputation as one of Japan’s finest.

name: Okunomatsu Sparkling Junmai Daiginjo - 290 ml
description:
Okunomatsu Sparkling Junmai Daiginjo is brewed in Fukushima by one of the most famous brewery from this region. It is one of the few sparkling Junmai Daiginjo sakes, characterized by its exceptional refinement and elegant bubbles, resulting from a second fermentation in the bottle.

With a rice polishing ratio of 50%, this sake offers a floral and elegant taste.Turn the bottle upside down for 1 minute so the left over sediment can distribute evenly.Serve this sake cold in a flute.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:11.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoStyle:SparklingContent:290mlRice polishing ratio:50%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:-25Acidity:2.5How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Okunomatsu Sparkling Junmai Daiginjo is brewed in Fukushima by one of the most famous brewery from this region. Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:11.

name: Miwatari Petillant Junmai Ginjo - 300 ml
description: It is brewed as a sake that pairs well with both Japanese and French cuisine. "Pétillant" refers to the light small bubbles in the sake created by the natural carbon dioxide produced during fermentation which are s retained in the bottle.An elegant aroma, with notes of white peach, pear, lychee, currants, and a hint of marshmallow. On the palate, a pleasant, natural, delicate carbonation. Reminiscent of young full bodied wine, it has a slight minerality, followed by a soft sweetness like ripe stone fruit with round, umami rice notes. A slightly peppery spice lingers on the palate, with a lingering finish.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:17.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:Limited edition, SparklingContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:59%Rice type:HitogokochiSMV:-2Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Sakura Label Daiginjo - 300 ml
description:
Sakura Label Daiginjo
is everything you are looking for in a Daiginjo sake. More pronounced notes in
taste and smell than a classic Junmai Daiginjo, lots of fruit and floral notes
because this extra taste and smell is obtained by adding brewer's alcohol.
Cherries, strawberry and anise on the nose, fine acidity with a balanced
sweetness on the pallet with a hint of umami. A delicious pure sake completes
the sake.This sake is delicious with pure dishes such as Sashimi but also a
perfect accompaniment to pasta.This sake is best enjoyed cold in a sake/wine
glass.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%, 15.5%Classification:DaiginjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:50%SMV:+5Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Giftbox:YesImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Sasa Nigori - 300 ml
description: Sasa Nigori is charming because of the lightly lees since less fine pressing has taken place. This means that minimal small particles have come, resulting in a slightly cloudy sake. It gives a wonderful sensation of silk feeling on your tongue while consuming.Nice balance and a nice aftertaste.The rice sediment makes it excellent to drink with rice dishes such as Onigiri and Sushi.Shake the bottle beforehand and then serve cold in a earthen guimomi.Prefecture:GifuAlcohol:15.3%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuYeast:Kyokai 9SMV:+/- 0Acidity:1.2show moreshow less

name: Dassai 45 Junmai Daiginjo - 300 ml
description: Dassai 45 Junmai Daiginjo is a super soft sake with a nose with refined tones of melon, mandarin and blossom. Nice intensive mouthfeel and a wonderful aftertaste.Recommended for grilled shellfish and fish such as lobster with teriyaki sauce and with miso marinated cod.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:YamaguchiAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoStyle:KosherContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:45%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiSMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.4show moreshow less

name: Gassan no Yuki Junmai Ginjo - 300 ml
description: Gassan No Yuki is an easily drinkable sake with a lot of anise and blossom in the bouquet. The sake has fresh acids, full taste and a clean finish.Delicious sake to consume with sashimi and modern sushi such as California Rolls.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:YamagataAlcohol:15.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:50%Rice type:Dewa-SansanYeast:Yamagata LocalSMV:+1Acidity:1.3show moreshow less

name: Keiryu Yamada-nishiki Daiginjo - 300 ml
description:
Keiryu Daiginjo is
made with Yamada nishiki from Hyogo Prefecture, which is polished to 50% and
yeast No. 1801, which is used to create a balance of flavour and aroma. It has a fruity aroma and a refreshing dry flavour that pairs well with
Japanese food. The Keiryu Daiginjo has won awards not only in Japan but also in
overseas competitions. A sake that can therefore be considered perfect for both
a Western and Asian pallet.Soft and harmonious. Pineapple, orange peel, pear, lychee and melon in the
mouth and nose. Refreshing fruity style with medium body and a super finish. Delicious with a Caesar Salad and Nigiri Sushi.This sake is best served cold in the special Sophienwald sake glass.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:16.0%Classification:DaiginjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:50%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiYeast:Kyokai 1801SMV:+4Acidity:1.2How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info:
Keiryu Daiginjo is
made with Yamada nishiki from Hyogo Prefecture, which is polished to 50% and
yeast No. Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:16.

name: Keiryu Kuragakoi Honjozo - 720 ml
description: Keiryu Kuragakoi Honjozo is a typical traditional made Honjozo. Earth, lactic, cereal but also creamy, juicy citrus fruits in the nose. On the pallate smooth, rounded texture with lots of Umami. Pronounced acidity leads to a dry and fine finish.This Sake won gold at the International Wine Challenge a numerous time.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%Rice type:Shirakaba-nishikiSMV:+/- 0Acidity:1.4How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)Giftbox:NoImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Meiri Tokiwasakari Junmai - 720 ml
description: Meiri Tokiwasakari is a classic example of Junmai Sake with lots of tones of grain, dairy, umami both in the nose and on the palette, making it an ideal sake to drink both cold and warm.Nice with savory dishes such as cheese but also delicious with pasta.This sake is best served cold and room temperature in a Guinomi or warm in an O-Choko.Prefecture:IbarakiAlcohol:14.5%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:68%Yeast:Kyokai 10SMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.2How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)show moreshow less

name: Taru Honjozo - 720 ml
description: Tsukasabotan’sTaru Honjozois crafted with traditional techniques handed down through generations, allowing the cedar barrels to impart their character to a crisp, dry Honjozo sake. The sake reveals a refined balance of cedar aroma with a light, dry and clean profile.When tasted, a gentle spread of woody fragrance appears—subtle yet present—followed by a solid, rich flavour with natural depth. It can be enjoyed chilled, at room temperature, or warmed, and pairs particularly well with dishes such as wild vegetables and mushrooms.Founded in 1603 in the Tosa region,Tsukasabotan Brewing Companyuses underground water from the Niyodo River, one of Japan’s clearest rivers. Legend tells that sake brewed with this water was once offered to the gods. Across the centuries, Tsukasabotan has placed quality first; even during wartime rice shortages, the brewery reduced production volumes rather than compromise, securing its reputation as a respected national brand.Prefecture:KochiAlcohol:15.5%Classification:HonjozoStyle:Taru, Taru sake (Taruzake)Content:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%SMV:+5Acidity:1.4How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Across the centuries, Tsukasabotan has placed quality first; even during wartime rice shortages, the brewery reduced production volumes rather than compromise, securing its reputation as a respected national brand. Prefecture:KochiAlcohol:15.

name: Gekkeikan Horin Junmai Daiginjo - 300 ml
description:
Gekkeikan Horin is a Japanese Junmai Daiginjo Sake and it shows exact  the pursuit of the Japanese perfection.The rice used for this sake is a special sake rice, sake rice is only used for exclusive high quality sake. The rice is often harvested manually and is on average four times more expensive than good table rice. This sake is a blend of the two most famous sake rice species; The Yamada-chiki and the Gohyakuman goku.This sake comes from Kyoto, this prefecture city is responsible for almost 15% of all sake produced in Japan. The former imperial capital owes its popularity to here, among other things, special soft water with the name Yume-Misu which means dream water.Everyone who came into contact with Sake knows the name Gekkeikan what Lauwererenkrans means. The brewery is known among the general public for the large -scale pure sake and among the connoisseurs around the high -quality manually brewed sake where Horin sake is a showpiece. Public secret about this brewery is that they even make sake for the imperial court.Very elegant sake with lots of fruit and florality. Balanced taste with a nice final. Nice combinations with light starters, white fish, sushi and vegetables. Serving advice is cold around ten degrees in a wine glass.
 The Sake Meter Value is +2 This means that the sake has a small sweetness.Alcohol percentage is around 15% and this is on average for high qualities sake.Ingredients are rice, koji-chin, yeast and water.Prefecture:KyotoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:50%Rice type:Gohyakuman-goku, Yamada-nishikiSMV:+2show moreshow less
manufacturer_info: This sake comes from Kyoto, this prefecture city is responsible for almost 15% of all sake produced in Japan. The brewery is known among the general public for the large -scale pure sake and among the connoisseurs around the high -quality manually brewed sake where Horin sake is a showpiece.

name: Kikumasamune Taru Junmai sake - 720 ml
description: Kikumasamune Taru Sake is a Taru Sake, on Yoshino Cedaren barrels. The sake is dry, elegant with something tannin and a delicate cedaroma.Enjoy this sake in combination with miso marinated cod or eel with a kabayaki sauce.This sake comes into its own when it is served cold in a white wine glass.Prefecture:HyogoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Taru sake (Taruzake)Content:720mlRice polishing ratio:73%SMV:+5Acidity:1.7show moreshow less

name: Nito Satin Junmai - 500 ml
description: Nito Satin is a beautiful velvety Junmai Sake with an alcohol percentage of 13%. Because of the fine acids in combination with the light sweetness, wonderfully balanced. Fine, pure, beautiful fruit tones with slightly roasted tones through it.This sake is best consumed cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:AichiAlcohol:13.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:500mlSMV:-16Acidity:2.4How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)show moreshow less

name: Kyokuko Sparkling Kijoshu - 375 ml
description: Kyokuko Sparkling Kijoshu is complete different from any other sake with bubbles through the unique Kijoshu brewing method. With this special method, a full powerful sweet sake is created with a very nice balance between the sweet on the one hand and the acids in the sake on the other. A sublime lush sake with bubbles is the result. Nice mousse, nice fruit in the nose and on the pallet, lots of umami and a fantastic fine aftertaste.When brewing sake, the Moromi tank is normally filled in three steps for four days. The first day the tank is filled for 1/6 with the yeast starter, steamed rice, koji rice and water. The second day is not done anything, the third day the quantity in the tank is doubled, then 2/6 steamed rice, Koji and water is added. The fourth day this amount is doubled with the addition of 3/6 tank of steamed rice, koji and water. With the Kijoshu method, the fourth day of sake is added instead of water, making the sake much sweeter and fuller after fermentation than with the normal method.This sake can be served with desserts but also as a apertif.This sake is best served cold in a flûte.Prefecture:TochigiAlcohol:12.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Kijoshu, SparklingContent:375mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:HitogokochiSMV:-76Acidity:4.2How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Hakkaisan Sparkling Nigori - 360 ml
description:
Hakkaisan Sparkling Nigori is a subtle light sparkling sake with soft bubbles and one side -like structure. Due to the second fermentation in the bottle, there is a fine amount of small rice particles such as sediment that provides an extra taste sensation.
 The Sake has fine light fruit in the nose and taste, beautiful acids and a lively aftertaste.Not only is the Hakkaisan Sparkling Nigori Sake extremely suitable as a refreshing aperitif, it is also appropriate to serve with a complete Japanese meal. When you ask a Japanese for the top 10 best Sake Breweries, Hakkaisan is the name that, together with Urakasumi from Miyagi, almost always appears on their list. Even at the basic sake of this brewery (Futsu-shu), the rice is already topped for 40%, which is equal to the requirements for a Ginjo Premium Sake.
 
 The water for this sake is known as Raid-Sama No Mizu What does water from the God Raiden. It is fresh melt water that flows from Hakkai mountain.From the brewery we also have the beautiful Daiginjo and one of the most exclusive Sake in Japan in our range of the  limited edition Junmai Daiginjo Kongoshin Winter Sake.Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Nigori, Sparkling, Usu-nigoriContent:360mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Gohyakuman-goku, Yamada-nishiki, YukinoseiYeast:Kyokai 701SMV:-23Acidity:1.6show moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Even at the basic sake of this brewery (Futsu-shu), the rice is already topped for 40%, which is equal to the requirements for a Ginjo Premium Sake. From the brewery we also have the beautiful Daiginjo and one of the most exclusive Sake in Japan in our range of the  limited edition Junmai Daiginjo Kongoshin Winter Sake.

name: Keiryu Asa-shibori Shuppin Honjozo Nama - 720 ml
description:
Keiryu Asa-shibori Shuppin is a limited-edition
sake that is brewed and stored in the same way as the brewery's special
competition sake. It's a popular sake among sake connoisseurs, as it brings out
the original umami, sweetness, and acidity best of sake. The sake ferments at a
low temperature for three days longer than usual, eventually bringing the
alcohol content to 20%. It is bottled and immediately stored on ice as soon as it is pressed early in
the morning.Concentrated and juicy, well balanced with mild sweetness, white peach,
berries, persimmon. Creamy texture and a spicy aftertaste.Scampi with garlic is a dish almost not to combine with wine, but this sake
does the match seamlessly.It is best to serve this sake cold in a white wine glass.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:20.0%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NamaContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%Rice type:Shirakaba-nishikiSMV:-6Acidity:2.0How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info:
Keiryu Asa-shibori Shuppin is a limited-edition
sake that is brewed and stored in the same way as the brewery's special
competition sake. Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:20.

name: Jozen White Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Jozen White is a soft light elegant Junmai Ginjo Sake from Brewery Shirataki from Niigata, with fruit tones of strawberry, pear and melon. The taste is medium dry, round with a delicate aftertaste. Just like Sake with bubbles, this sake is also very interesting for the starting sake drinker.Easy combinations with grilled dishes completely when use is made of teriyaki sauce or salt.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:14.5%Classification:Junmai GinjoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:+5Acidity:1.5Giftbox:Yesshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Jozen White is a soft light elegant Junmai Ginjo Sake from Brewery Shirataki from Niigata, with fruit tones of strawberry, pear and melon. Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:14.

name: Saku-Saku Hojozo Karakuchi - 720 ml
description: Saku-Saku Karakuchi Okunomatsu is an easy-to-drink Honjozo with aromas of exotic fruit, roasted grain and rice flour on the nose. On the palate, the umami character stands out, complemented by refined dry notes that also linger in the finish. Karakuchi means “dry” in Japanese and is often used to describe sake with a distinctly dry flavour profile.This sake pairs especially well with spicy Asian dishes, offering a pleasant counterbalance.It can be enjoyed both chilled and gently warmed.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:Koshi Ibuki, MassiguraSMV:+2Acidity:1.4How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Denshin Tsuchi Honjozo - 720 ml
description:
Denshin Tsuchi Honjozo is a classically made sake with lots of earthy, dairy and grain tones. Full of power with a pleasant aftertaste.
 
 Nice companion of classic Japanese dishes such as Yakiimo, Shabu Shabu and Yakimono.
 
 This sake is best served cold in a guinomi or warm in an O-Choko.Prefecture:FukuiAlcohol:15.5%Classification:HonjozoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:+2Acidity:1.0How to serve:Atsukan (hot)show moreshow less

name: Hourai Josen - 720 ml
description: Hourai Jousen is an award-winning sake and an exceptional futsushu. It displays an elegant, clean fruitiness reminiscent of higher-grade sake, supported by a rich, satisfying texture. Brewed from plump steamed rice polished to 70%, the palate is round with gentle acidity, a touch of sweetness and fine intensity. The aroma is fresh and clean, with notes of cedar and nutmeg, while the flavours bring citrus and floral apricot, finishing rounded and pure.Watanabe Hourai is based in central Japan in the charming town of Hida-Furukawa, Gifu Prefecture.Prefecture:GifuAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Futsu-shuContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%SMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.4How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Kuboto Hyakuju Tokubetsu Honjozo - 720 ml
description:
Kubota Hyakuju is an elegant style Honjozo Sake with tones of honey, grain, dairy in the nose and on the palate, dry pure aftertaste.
 
 Original dishes from Niigata such as Hegi soba noodles and Suruten a kind of tempura combine well with this sake.This sake is best served cold in a guinomi or warm in an O-Choko.Prefecture:NiigataAlcohol:15.0%Classification:Tokubetsu HonjozoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:General sake rice, Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:+1Acidity:1.0How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)show moreshow less

name: Keiryu Shinanoya-Kahei Junmai - 720 ml
description: Shinoya Kahei Junmai is another masterpiece from Endo Brewery Nagano. Considered and awarded as one of the best Junmai sake from Japan. Juicy citrus fruits in the nose with nice accents of rice, toasted grain and banana. Round texture full of umami. witrh a silk feeling. Pronounced acidity which leads to a dry aftertaste.Great with grilled dishes.Best served at any temperature depending on the occasion.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%Rice type:Shirakaba-nishikiSMV:+1Acidity:1.3How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Yonetsuru Kappa Honjozo - 720 ml
description: Yonetsuru Kappa Honjozois adorned with the renowned "Kappa" illustration by the artist Ogawa Imasen, it caters to your preference for a drier profile. Enjoy the authentic and sharp taste of this dry Honjozo with a crisp finish.The label was created by Ogawa Ikuzen, a famous painter known for his paintings of kappa (water pandas).Prefecture:YamaguchiAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:100% Local grownSMV:+5show moreshow less

name: Kyokuko Special Junmai - 720 ml
description: Kyokuko Special Junmai is a prize winning rich velvety Junmai Sake made with water from the mountainous area Tochigi. The pure water in combination with the locally renovated Yumesasara rice results in full powerful sake with a lot of finesse at the same time.This sake can be served cold in a wine glass or warm in a sake cup.Prefecture:TochigiAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:YumesasaraSMV:+2Acidity:1.6How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Azumacho Honjozo - 720 ml
description: Azumacho Honjozo is crafted exclusively from rice grown in Saga Prefecture, capturing the natural umami and sweetness of the region's premium rice. Deeply rooted in Saga’s local traditions, this sake embodies authenticity and refinement. Produced using the traditional three-stage brewing method typically reserved for high-grade sake, it achieves its rich flavour without relying on sweeteners or enzyme agents. Azumacho Honjozo stands as a testament to craftsmanship, making it the most beloved sake in its class.Prefecture:SagaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:68%Rice type:ReihouYeast:Kyokai 7SMV:-8Acidity:1.5show moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Azumacho Honjozo is crafted exclusively from rice grown in Saga Prefecture, capturing the natural umami and sweetness of the region's premium rice. Prefecture:SagaAlcohol:15.

name: Okunomatsu Tokubetsu Junmai - 720 ml
description: Okunomatsu Tokubetsu Junmai offers a gentle aroma and a deep flavour characteristic of junmai sake. Brewed from domestic rice polished to 60%, in-house yeast, and pure groundwater aged for 40 years from Mount Adatara. A light, nutty aroma opens into a soft sweetness that appeals broadly, finishing with an earthy touch that refreshes like mountain air. Best enjoyed chilled in a Sophienwald sake glass together with close friends or family.Prefecture:FukushimaContent:720mlHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Komachi Sakura - 720 ml
description: Komachi Sakura from Watanabe Hourai (Gifu) presents subtle aromas of white flowers, white asparagus and fresh rock melon. The palate carries fruity ume plum notes with a lingering mineral aftertaste. Medium-bodied with a refined texture and a balanced finish.Awards won in recent years; IWC 2018 Commended, IWC 2019 Bronze, IWC 2020 Silver, IWC 2021 Commended, IWC 2022 Gold.Prefecture:GifuClassification:Futsu-shuContent:720mlHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Homare Nigori - 720 ml
description:
Homare Nigori is a
delicious creamy cloudy sake with a fine velvety structure on the tongue due to
the rice sediment. The Nigori Sake of Aizu Homare has a history dating back to
the beginning of the Showa period. While retaining the traditional essence of
this Nigori Sake, efforts have been made to adapt it to modern desires. The
fruity aroma, reminiscent of bananas, harmonizes the sweetness and acidity,
enhancing the overall freshness of the drink. It is known for being an
invigorating sake with a flavor that is both refreshing and not overly
sweet.Shake before use so
that the rice sediment passes through the entire bottle.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:70%SMV:-25Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Shiroki-Tenryu Nigori - 720 ml
description: The Kikusui Shiroki-Lenryu is a silky-soft Nigori Sake with a rich rice caroma with creamy in the mouth. The mild sweetness and Umami come up well when serving hot, although most unfiltered sake's are recommended to drink cooled. Juicy, creamy and ripe with apple and banana fruit in the mouth. Sweet and spicy with honey rice, apple and peach fruit, creamy yogurt, mandarin and brown sugar as a aftertaste. This is highly recommended, it is not without reason that different international sake prices won, including the prestigious International Wine Challenge in 2021.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.3%Classification:HonjozoStyle:NigoriContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:65%How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Awards:IWC 2025 - Gold Award WinnerGiftbox:NoImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Black Junmai - 720 ml
description: Black Junmai is a unique Junmai sake since the rice polishing is very low at 82%.They are using the famous flat rice polishing method which gives much more flavor and comes with less polishing still closer to the core of the rice grain.Nice full bodied sake with lots of rice tonesPrefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:82%Rice type:Takane-nishikiSMV:+3.5Acidity:1.9How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated)Giftbox:NoImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Nice full bodied sake with lots of rice tonesPrefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.

name: Mitsutake Tezukuri Junmai - 720ml
description:
Mitsutake Tezukuri is
an artisanal Junmai sake that excels with umami and its intense rice flavor.
Sometimes you want to be surprised by a sake and sometimes you want to get
exactly what you expect. This sake is exactly what you would expect from a Junmai
such as Umami, a fine acidity, slightly fatty and a robust taste. Also in terms
of nose, this sake is completely right, lots of grain, earthy notes, some dairy
and some fruit such as banana.Prefecture:SagaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:50%SMV:+/- 0Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

A well-balanced, slightly dry Daiginjo.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:16.0%Classification:DaiginjoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:50%Yeast:Kyokai 1801SMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.6How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Kiwami Junmai Daiginjo - 720 ml
description: Kiwami Junmai Daiginjo from Aizu Homare is made from Gohyakuman-Goku Rice that is polished up to 50% and Association 1801 yeast. The brewery states that this affordable Junmai Daiginjo was made to enjoy at home. The Kiwami has an elegant scent and a crispy, powerful taste, expertly manufactured by master brewer Nakajima. He has won fourteen gold medals at the National New Sake Competition and the IWC, the world's leading wine competition.Best to combine with white fish and shellfish sashimi, smoked ham and smoked duck.Please enjoy this sake cold in a white wine glass.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:50%SMV:+/- 0Acidity:1.5How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

description: Okunomatsu Tokubetsu Junmai offers a gentle aroma and a deep flavour characteristic of junmai sake. name: Miwatari Karakuchi Junmai - 720 ml
description:
Miwatari Karakuchi Junmai is a beautiful dry sake with a powerful full taste where a lot of Umami predominates. Roasted grains, banana, steamed rice and dairy in the smell. The somewhat fat aftertaste lingers nicely.It is a typical locally brewed sake, made with 100% Hitogokochi from Nagano Prefecture.
Surprising possibilities to serve with different dishes through variation of serving temperature.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:HitogokochiSMV:+4Acidity:1.2How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Cocktail, Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Adatara Ginjo - 720 ml
description:
Adatara Ginjo from Okunomatsu was named as Japan best sake in 2018. The sake won the prize at the most prestigious sake blind tasting in the world, the International Wine Challenge, where no less than 1639 top sake were submitted.
Lots of fruit such as melon, pear and lychee in the aroma and on the pallet with subtle, beautiful acidity that accentuates the fine flavours nicely. A lovely clean aftertaste completes this one.This sake can be drunk on its own but also tastes great with cheese and lighter dishes.This sake is best enjoyed cold in a sake/wine glass.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.5%Classification:GinjoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%SMV:+4Acidity:1.3Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Toko Genshu Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Toko Genshu is an experience the luxurious taste accompanied by a delightful aroma and sweetness, reminiscent of savoring perfectly ripened fruits. Despite being Genshu (undiluted after pressing), it maintains a modest 16.0% Alcohol by Volume, ensuring a satisfying indulgence without overwhelming fatigue. This particular offering from Toko stands out as one of their most sought-after products, delivering excellent value for its price.Prefecture:YamagataAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoContent:720mlRice type:100% Local grownHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)show moreshow less

name: Sasa Nigori - 500 ml
description: Sasa Nigori - 500ml gets his charming caracter because with this sake slightly less fine pressing has taken place. The result is that minimal small particles have come with rice, resulting in a slightly cloudy sake. It gives a wonderful sensation of silk feeling on your tongue while consuming.Nice balance and a fine aftertaste.The rice sediment makes it an excellent companion to drink together with rice dishes such as Onigiri and Sushi. Shake the bottle beforehand and then serve cold in a earthern Guinomi cup.Prefecture:GifuAlcohol:15.3%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:NigoriContent:500mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuYeast:Kyokai 9SMV:+/- 0Acidity:1.2show moreshow less

name: Dassai 45 Sparkling Nigori - 360 ml
description:
Dassai Sparkling 45 is a delicious fresh Junmai Daiginjo sake with a fine mousse and a silky structure. Lively with a fruity aroma, not too sweet. A worthy counterpart of champagne but with a slight sour.
 
 Delicious as an aperitif and with a dessert but also perfect for just drinking.This sake can best be served cold in a champagne flûte.Keep upside down a minute before opening so the rice sediment can distributed in the bottle.Prefecture:YamaguchiAlcohol:14.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoStyle:Nigori, SparklingRice polishing ratio:45%Rice type:Yamada-nishikishow moreshow less

name: Niyodo Blue Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description:
Niyodo Blue is a sake
made by one of the most famous breweries in Kochi "Tsukasabotan". The
special thing about this sake is that the water comes from the blessed Niyodo
River, Japan's most beautiful and famous river that is famous for its
fascinating blue colour and the purity of the water. The bouquet of the sake is
characterized by light fruit, banana, pear and melon, but also with hints of
roasted grain and butter. The taste is smooth and light and finishes with a
fine finish.Prefecture:KochiAlcohol:16.5%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Rivier waterContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:100% Local grownSMV:+6Acidity:1.7How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Kitakata Terroir Episode II - Junmai - 720 ml
description:
Kitakata Terroir
Episode II Junmai is a Junmai Muroka Genshu sake, or pure rice sake without
carbon filtration to which no water has been added before bottling.The sake is made from Yumenokaori sake rice from Kitakata and yeast that was locally
developed in Fukushima.In the nose hints of Muscat grapes, melon and Lychee. On the slightly dry
pallet, the beautiful, powerful, full, robust taste with lots of Umami stands
out. The finish is refined and very enjoyable.A powerful sake that combines wonderfully with grilled dishes, especially when
offered hot.The sake can be served cold in a white wine glass or hot in an
O-Choko.Prefecture:FukushimaAlcohol:15.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Genshu, MurokaContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:70%Rice type:YumenokaoriYeast:Kyokai 701, UtsukushimayumeSMV:+1.5Acidity:1.6How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated), Hiya (room temperature)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Kagatsuru Junmai - 720 ml
description: Yachiya Kagatsuru Junmaiis a mild yet full-bodied sake that highlights the natural depth and richness of rice. Brewed with precision and care, it offers a smooth, rounded profile where gentle umami notes harmonise with a clean finish. This Junmai is versatile – ideal to enjoy on its own, but also an excellent companion to light appetisers, grilled dishes, or traditional Japanese cuisine.Prefecture:IshikawaAlcohol:15.3%Classification:JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:Gohyakuman-gokuSMV:+1Acidity:1.6show moreshow less

name: Takanenishiki Junmai - 720 ml
description: Takanenishiki Junmai is made with a rice species that is unique to Nagano, the Takane-nichiki rice, A fragile rice grain full of taste that is difficult to brew. It is a cross between Gohyaku-Mangoku and Miyama-nichiki,. These blend of the two most used rice species for Sake, creates an elegant bouquet and aroma that is representative of an easily drinkable sake to enjoy with lots of good food.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:Junmai, Tokubetsu JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Takane-nishikiSMV:+5Acidity:1.5How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated), Yukihie (very cold)Giftbox:YesImporter:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Shichiken Yamano Sparkling - 360 ml
description: Shichiken Yamano Sparkling is a beautiful elegant semi -dry sparkling sake with a subtle mousse. Complex with a good balance and a fine aftertaste.Delicious as a fresh aperitif but also good combinations with a sushi meal or raw oysters.This sake is best served in a champagne flûte.Keep it upside down and let it rest for a minute before opening.Prefecture:YamanashiAlcohol:11.0%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Sparkling, Usu-nigoriContent:360mlRice polishing ratio:67%Rice type:Hitogokochishow moreshow less

name: Uchu Space Sake Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Uchu Shu Space Sake is a special Junmai Sake that, unlike most Junmai sake, has more fruit tones than grain tones and dairy. In 2005, the yeast of this sake was further developed at a height of 400km. Yeast, when brewing Sake not only ensures the conversion of sugars to alcohol, but is to a large extent responsible for fruit and floral tones in Sake. The sake is soft with subtle tones of pear and melon.The aftertaste is delicious and pure.Prefecture:KochiAlcohol:15.5%Classification:JunmaiStyle:Space Rice, Space YeastContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:Gin no Yume - Space RiceSMV:+5Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Keiryu 150th Anniversary Ginjo - 720 ml
description:
Keiryu 150thAnniversary Ginjo was made first time In honour of the brewery's 150th Anniversary. In 2024 the sake was awarded as best Ginjo from Japan out of the
1504 sake submitted in total for The International Wine Challenge.Everything you hope to ever find in a Ginjo sake is in this sake. Abundant
typical Ginjo notes of melon, apple and petals, Wasanbon and Muscat grape. Delicate and fresh on the pallet with a good depth of floral characteristics.
Endlessly beautiful long in the aftertaste. Delicious with Spaghetti Carbonara and aged hard cheese.This sake is best enjoyed cold in a white wine glass.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.0%Classification:GinjoContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiSMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.3How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less
manufacturer_info: Keiryu 150thAnniversary Ginjo was made first time In honour of the brewery's 150th Anniversary. Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:15.

name: Keiryu Koringosan Junmai Ginjo - 720ml
description:
Keiryu Koringosan Junmai Ginjo is a new type of sake created using the newly developed Nagano R yeast.Low in alcohol 
and easy to drink, it has a fruit-like flavor, a hint of sweetness, and 
moderate acidity that enhances the taste of food. The aroma is enhanced 
when served in a wine glass, and it can be enjoyed on its own as well as
 with food.Prefecture:NaganoAlcohol:13.0%Classification:Junmai GinjoStyle:GenshuContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:59%Rice type:Miyama-nishikiYeast:Appel, Nagano RSMV:-10How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive importshow moreshow less

name: Masumi Shiro White Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Masumi Shiro White is a wonderful elegant sake with an alcohol percentage of just 12%. Nice light fruit tones in the nose such as ripe apple, pear and banana. Medium dry with lots of umami and fine acids on the pallet, a fine aftertaste completes this sake.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.

name: Ninki Black Junmai Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Ninki Black Junmai Ginjo is brewed with handmade koji and bottle-aged for about six months after top vatting to prevent oxidation and deterioration. Smooth and polished, with a gentle ginjo aroma and a full-bodied flavour.Best served from a wine glass.

name: L'Atelier du Sake Daiginjo - 500 ml
description: L 'Atelier du Sake has a drifting bouquet of tropical fruit, apple and melon with a subtle hint of apricot and black sugar. On the palette a nice balance with fine acids and a huge depth of many taste impressions, fine aftertaste. Because this sake is not filtered with a carbon filter and is undiluted, combinations with powerful grilled dishes such as Yakitori possible.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.The sake is brewed by Shirakabegura from Kobe with the special Miya-Misu water.

name: Navy Label Junmai Daiginjo - 720 ml
description: Product information "Navy Label Junmai Daiginjo - 720ml"Prefecture:FukushimaClassification:Junmai DaiginjoContent:720mlHow to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Importer:Sake.nl - own exclusive import
manufacturer_info: The brewery founded in 1716 is now under the leadership of its 19th president, Joji Yusa. Okunomatsu is dedicated to producing sake that is both high quality and affordable. The brewery has gained worldwide fame with their fantastic sake and has a unique bottle design.

name: Minatoya Tosuke Junmai Daiginjo - 630 ml
description: Minatoya Tosuke is named after the founder of the Shirataki brewery, An elegant Junmai Daiginjo Sake which creates fine scents of fresh apples and apricots. Nice soft and fine sake with a dry finish.Ideal accompany Sashimi and Sushi but also a tasty sake to drink throughout the whole meal.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.
manufacturer_info: Minatoya Tosuke is named after the founder of the Shirataki brewery. The Shirataki brewery is located just 70 minutes by bullet train from Tokyo in the sake-famous region of Niigata. The founder, Minatoya Tosuke, had the idea to brew sake with pure underground water. For the rice, famous sake rice varieties are used such as Gohyakuman-goku, Yamada-nishiki, and also Japan's most famous table rice Koshihikari. Making sake that can be enjoyed throughout the world is the goal of Shirataki, and therefore they brew very accessible, friendly sake.

name: Karahashi Yamada-nishiki - 720 ml
description: Karahashi Yamada-nishiki of Aizu Homare is a Muroka Genshu sake made with hundred percent Yamada-nishiki rice, exclusively obtained from the Hyogo prefecture. Carefully brewed with ultra soft water, "Kitakara Meisui," from a depth of 100 meters below ground. After the press process, the sake is immediately bottled and space is given to mature the flavors. This is followed by fast cooling up to -5 Celsius in a cooled room. Every step in making this sake is carried out under strict supervision, until just before it is ready for shipment.This beautiful made sake reveals a bouquet that is reminiscent of apples and tropical fruit, with an exuberant scent. The unique and extensive flavor profile, specific to Yamada-Nishiki, is characterized by its lush and balanced interplay of acidity and sweetness. The refreshing, crispy aftertaste with a touch of sharpness is another characteristic of this exceptional sake, the result of dedicated craftsmanship and accurate control until the moment it is served in your glass.Receiver of the 2017 IWC (International Wine Challenge) 'Gold medal Trophy' in the Junmai Ginjo Sake category.

name: Kubota Senju Ginjo - 720 ml
description: Kubota Senju Ginjo has a friendly nose with tones of apple, pear and lychees, low minerality, soft tender velvety taste with a clean "kire".Excellent choice as a supervisor for a wide range of Japanese dishes including grilled and fried dishes.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.

name: Chiyomidori Tokubetsu Junmai - 720 ml
description: Chiyomidori Tokubetsu Junmaiis crafted with a unique yeast strain discovered within the brewery itself, resulting in a dry, fresh sake with a refined, wine-like character. Its brilliant clarity reveals layers of ripe peach and pear, lifted by delicate herbal notes. On the palate, juicy flavours of apple and gentle umami from the rice are balanced by lively acidity and a subtle astringency on the finish, reminiscent of a crisp white wine.Produced by Okuda Sake Brewery, the smallest brewery in Akita Prefecture with a history of over 340 years, this sake is made using the rare “MS3” yeast found in the rafters of the brewery. The yeast imparts a distinctive freshness and structure, making Chiyomidori Tokubetsu Junmai a perfect introduction for wine lovers discovering sake, while offering the depth and craftsmanship sought by connoisseurs.Prefecture:AkitaAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Tokubetsu JunmaiContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:60%Rice type:Gin San (Akita)SMV:+8Acidity:1.7How to serve:Atsukan (hot), Hanahie (refrigerated)

name: Higen Junmai - 720 ml
description:
Higen Premium Junmai Daiginjo is made with 100% Yamada-nishiki from Hyogo
Prefecture.
It is characterized by a deep, gorgeous aroma
reminiscent of fruit, a soft mouthfeel, elegant
sweetness, and a crisp aftertaste.When you taste the sake you will find different layers, awesome balance and a superb long exciting finish.Balance is the keyword of the sake.Prefecture:GunmaAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoStyle:Exclusieve importContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:35%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiSMV:-6Acidity:1.3How to serve:Hanahie (refrigerated)Giftbox:YesImporter:Ma Sake - flown in directly from Japan, Sake.nl - own exclusive import

name: Gasanryu Ura Koka Honjozo - 720 ml
description: Gasanryu Ura Koka has a nice light yellow -green color because this sake has not undergone carbon filtering. Lots of fruit such as melon and pear but also showing roasted grains. Sake has a pleasant aftertaste. Friendly easily drinkable sake that adapts well to dishes and therefore easy to deployed in various corridors in a lunch or dinner.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:YamagataAlcohol:14.0%Classification:HonjozoStyle:Muroka, Nama-zumeContent:720mlRice polishing ratio:65%Rice type:Dewa no SatoYeast:YamagataSMV:+3 (licht droog)Acidity:1.3

name: Dassai 39 Junmai Daiginjo - 300 ml
description:
Dassai 23 - 300ml is one of the most famous and famous Junmai Daiginjo made by the Dassai.
 Beautiful tones of melon, pear, soft, complex and elegant with an eternal finish.Excellent combinations with lighter refined dishes.This sake is best served cold in a wine glass.Prefecture:YamaguchiAlcohol:16.0%Classification:Junmai DaiginjoStyle:KosherContent:300mlRice polishing ratio:23%Rice type:Yamada-nishikiSMV:+4Acidity:1.1
